result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Joseph Belz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $25 per month to the Clerk of Courts.
2) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
3) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
4) If the defendant fails to pay these financial obligations timely, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.
The defendant is eligible to have this matter expunged upon successful completion of probation.
If the defendant satisfies all conditions of probation with zero violations, he may petition to discharge off of probation after 6 months.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Joseph Belz

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Cases 22CF184 and 22CM90 called together.  Defendant Jeremy Joseph Belz in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeremy Joseph Belz.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Court from PLQ: def to plead to amended Ct 1 of 22cf184 (amending to possession of amphetamine) and Ct 1 of 22CM190 (possession of cocaine); joint rec for 1 yr probation, withheld sentence.  State provides basis for agreement.  Court reviews PLQ with def.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 22CF184 as stated; granted.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters guilty pleas.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 of 22CF184 and Count 1 of 22CM190 and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement, not objecting to expungement eligibility.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, requests expungement eligibility.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
Count 1 22CM190- 1 yr probation, 60 days jail imposed/stayed; $200 court costs (DNA only)
Count 1 22CF184- 1 yr probation, 60 days jail imposed/stayed; $200 court costs (DNA only)
Conditions of probation:
The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended. Gainful employment.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If def satisfies all conditions of probation and does not have any positive drug tests, can petition to discharge off of probation after 6 months.  Payments of $25 per month to Clerk of Courts office 1st payment due by end of Dec, 2022.  Eligible to have this matter expunged.  
 Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  13 days jail credit.

9:34 AM Cases 22CF184 and 22CM90 called together.  Defendant Jeremy Joseph Belz not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeremy Joseph Belz.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def fails to appear.  Cases were on for plea/sentencing.  Court reviews for service/notice.  Atty Chapman notes: misdemeanor resolution, doesn't believe FTA is intentional.  State not objecting to staying a warrant.  Atty Chapman responds.  Court willing to reset and stay warrant until that date and time.  Court orders warrant, $250 cash bond, stays until reset date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:58 PM Called 22CF184 scheduled for PH and 22CM90 for STC.  Defendant Jeremy Joseph Belz in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeremy Joseph Belz.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attny Chapman notes today will be a WOPH.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information which mirrors the criminal complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 10:08 AM Called 22CF184 for INIT and 22CM90 for STC.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy Joseph Belz in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeremy Joseph Belz. Case 22CF184 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. NG plea to misdemeanors.  PH waive time limits.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

1:05 PM Defendant Jeremy Belz appeared by video. Defense attorney Daniel Chapman appears in person.  State appears by James Rennicke in person.  Case on for bail/bond hearing on Atty Chapman's bond motion.  Court questions defendant.  Court reviews bond covering this case and 22CM90.  State responds- argues to keep some cash on the bond.  Court amends to signature bond, same conditions.  Atty Chapman believes he will be taking over both cases eventually.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Bond to cover Burnett County Cases 22GF198 and 22CM90.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. Defendant must actively look for gainful employment, must apply for at least 8 jobs by next date or obtain a job.
